content:
Camera angles are just one element of creating suspense and fear in horror films. Although they are crucial in building suspense and can add to the overall feeling of fear, a horror movie requires multiple elements to be truly scary. 

Some other elements that contribute to making a horror movie scary include storytelling, music and sound effects, lighting, character development, and special effects. For example, the way a story is told, the use of eerie music and sound effects, and the way a character is portrayed on screen can all create fear and dread in the audience.

Therefore, camera angles alone cannot make a horror movie scary if the other elements are not included in the film's production. Filmmakers must utilize multiple techniques to create a truly immersive and terrifying horror experience.
